snapshots.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this backup?
snapshots.confirmDeleteMultiple: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} backup?
snapshots.deleteWarningDetail: The selected backups will be permanently removed from the destination.
snapshots.snapshotCreatedDescription: The backup task has been started. Check the Tasks page for progress.
snapshots.snapshotCancelledDescription: The backup upload has been cancelled successfully.
snapshots.cannotBrowseDesc: This backup does not have browseable content. Try creating a new backup.
snapshots.cannotRestoreDesc: This backup does not have restorable content. Try creating a new backup.

pins.manageDescription: Add or remove pins to protect this backup from automatic deletion by retention policies.
pins.pinHint: Pins prevent backups from being deleted by retention policies

description.placeholder: Enter a description for this snapshot...

deleteSource.confirmDescription: This will permanently delete the backup source and its backup rule. This action cannot be undone.
deleteSource.warningNoSnapshots: This folder has no backups. You can delete the source to remove the backup configuration.

snapshotCreate.selectPathFirst: Select a path to view policy settings
snapshotCreate.infoMessage: Backups capture the current state of your files. Policies control retention and scheduling.
snapshotCreate.enablePolicyOverride: Apply custom policy to this backup
snapshotCreate.policyOverrideInfo: Set specific policy values to override defaults. Leave fields empty to use inherited values.

browse.downloadFolderDescription: Choose how you want to download this folder
browse.downloadFolderPrompt: How would you like to download '{{foldername}}'?
browse.cannotDownloadDirectory: Cannot download directories. Use restore to download entire directories.
browse.breadcrumbNavInfo: Navigate up by using the back button for now

restore.restoreInfoDesc: Details about the backup being restored
restore.restoreOptionsDesc: Choose how to restore the backup
restore.targetPathHelp: The directory where files will be restored
restore.zipFilePathHelp: The path where the zip archive will be created
restore.enterZipPath: Please enter a zip file path
restore.tarFilePathHelp: The path where the tar archive will be created
restore.enterTarPath: Please enter a tar file path
restore.warning: Warning: restoring files will overwrite existing data if the overwrite options are enabled. Make sure you have selected the correct target path.
restore.restoreProgressDesc: The restore is running in the background. You can monitor its progress on the

profiles.title: Backup Profiles

profiles.createProfileDescription: Create a new backup profile to group related directories
profiles.createFirstProfile: Create your first backup profile to get started
profiles.name: Profile Name
profiles.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe what this profile backs up
profiles.directoryAlreadyAdded: This directory is already in the profile
profiles.atLeastOneDirectory: Profile must have at least one directory
profiles.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the profile '{{name}}'? This action cannot be undone.
profiles.noDirectoriesToView: This profile has no directories to view backups for
profiles.noSnapshotsForProfile: No backups found for this profile's directories yet
profiles.policyDescription: This backup rule will be applied to all directories in the profile
profiles.policyApplied: Backup rule applied to all profile directories
profiles.policyApplicationFailed: Failed to apply backup rule to directories
profiles.dragDropHint: Or drag and drop folders here
profiles.policySettingsDescription: Configure backup rules for the first directory. Rules will be applied to all directories in this profile.
profiles.addDirectoryToConfigurePolicy: Add a directory to configure backup rules

policies.title: Backup Rules
policies.subtitle: Configure backup rules and schedules
policies.noPoliciesConfigured: No backup rules are configured yet
policies.hierarchyInfo: Kopia uses a 4-level rule hierarchy: global → host → user → path. More specific rules override less specific ones.
policies.globalPolicyWarning: You are editing the global Backup Rule (*/*/*). This is the base rule that all other rules inherit from. Changes here will affect all backups unless overridden by more specific rules. The global rule cannot be deleted.
policies.policySavedDescription: Backup rule has been saved successfully
policies.policyDeletedDescription: Backup rule has been deleted successfully
policies.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this backup rule? Values will revert to inherited defaults.
policies.editorInfo: Configure backup rule settings below. Leave fields empty to inherit from parent rules.
policies.inheritanceInfo: Fields marked as 'inherited' use values from parent rules in the hierarchy.
policies.globalEditorInfo: Configure global backup rule settings below. These values will be used as defaults for all backups.
policies.globalInheritanceInfo: Any values you set here will be inherited by all host, user, and path-specific rules unless they override them.
policies.intervalSecondsHelp: Time between automatic backups in seconds
policies.manualHelp: If enabled, backups will only be created manually
policies.runMissedHelp: If enabled, missed backups will be run when the system starts
policies.compressorNameHelp: Algorithm to use for compression (e.g., gzip, zstd, s2-default)
policies.ignoreRulesHelp: Glob patterns for files/directories to exclude from backups
policies.oneFileSystemHelp: Don't cross filesystem boundaries when creating backups
policies.maxFileSizeHelp: Skip files larger than this size (bytes)
policies.ignoreFileErrorsHelp: Continue backup even if individual files cannot be read
policies.ignoreDirectoryErrorsHelp: Continue backup even if individual directories cannot be read
policies.ignoreUnknownTypesHelp: Continue backup even if files with unknown types are encountered
policies.maxParallelSnapshotsHelp: Maximum number of backups to upload in parallel
policies.maxParallelFileReadsHelp: Maximum number of files to read in parallel during upload
policies.parallelUploadAboveSizeHelp: Files larger than this size will be uploaded in parallel chunks
policies.actionsPolicyHelp: Configure scripts or commands to run before/after backups. Use scripts for inline shell commands, or specify a command path with arguments.
policies.beforeSnapshotRootHelp: Script or command to run before starting the backup
policies.afterSnapshotRootHelp: Script or command to run after completing the backup
policies.beforeFolderHelp: Script to run before processing each folder
policies.afterFolderHelp: Script to run after processing each folder
policies.actionTimeoutHelp: Maximum time to wait for the action to complete
policies.actionModeHelp: Essential: backup fails if action fails. Optional: backup continues. Async: don't wait for completion.
policies.loggingPolicyHelp: Configure logging verbosity for backup operations. Values: 0=None, 5=Normal, 10=Max
policies.osSnapshotsPolicyHelp: Configure Volume Shadow Copy (VSS) for Windows. This allows backing up files that are in use.
policies.volumeShadowCopyHelp: When to use Volume Shadow Copy for open files
policies.noParentTimeOfDayHelp: Don't inherit scheduled times from parent rules
policies.timeOfDayHelp: Create backups at specific times (24-hour format, e.g., 09:00, 17:00)
policies.cronHelp: Advanced scheduling using UNIX cron syntax (e.g., '0 2 * * *' for daily at 2 AM)
policies.onlyCompressHelp: Only compress files with these extensions (e.g., .txt, .log, .json)
policies.noParentOnlyCompressHelp: Don't inherit the only-compress extensions list from parent rules
policies.neverCompressHelp: Never compress files with these extensions (e.g., .jpg, .mp4, .zip)
policies.noParentNeverCompressHelp: Don't inherit the never-compress extensions list from parent rules
policies.noParentIgnoreHelp: Don't inherit ignore rules from parent directories
policies.noParentDotFilesHelp: Don't inherit ignore rule files from parent directories

tasks.subtitle: Monitor and manage background tasks

tasks.confirmCancel: Are you sure you want to cancel this task? This action cannot be undone.
tasks.noLogsAvailable: No logs available for this task

preferences.byteFormatDescription: How file sizes are displayed throughout the app
preferences.minimizeToTrayDescription: Keep app running in system tray when window is closed
preferences.factoryResetDescription: Reset all preferences to their default values
preferences.factoryResetConfirmDescription: Are you sure you want to reset everything to default values?

service.title: Windows Service
service.description: Run Kopia server as a Windows system service that starts automatically with your computer.
service.elevationDescription: Service installation and management requires administrator privileges. You will be prompted for elevation when performing these operations.
service.installDescription: This will install Kopia Desktop as a Windows service that starts automatically with your system.
service.installWarning: The service will run with LocalSystem privileges and start automatically at boot. You can manage it from this page or Windows Services (services.msc).
service.uninstallDescription: This will remove the Kopia Desktop service from your system. The service must be stopped first.
service.uninstallWarning: This will remove the service registration. You can reinstall it later from this page if needed.
service.adminDescription: You may be prompted for administrator credentials to complete this operation.
service.elevationHelp: Please run the application as administrator (right-click → Run as administrator) to install or uninstall the service.

notificationProfiles.testSentDesc: Please check your notification destination to verify receipt.
notificationProfiles.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the profile "{{profileName}}"?

pushover.userKey: Recipient user key or group key
pushover.appTokenHelp: Create an app at pushover.net to get your app token
pushover.userKeyHelp: Found on your Pushover dashboard after logging in
pushover.step1: Sign up for a Pushover account at pushover.net
pushover.step2: Install the Pushover mobile app on your device (ios/android)
pushover.step3: Create a new application in your Pushover dashboard to get an app token
pushover.step4: Copy your user key from the Pushover dashboard

webhook.endpointHelp: The URL where notification data will be sent
webhook.headersHelp: Enter one header per line in the format "header-name: value"
webhook.requestFormatDesc: Kopia will send a {{method}} request to your endpoint with the notification content in the request body. The content will be formatted as {{format}}.

dialog.description: Configure how and when Kopia should send notifications for this profile.
dialog.profileNameHelp: Unique name for this notification profile
dialog.minimumSeverityHelp: Minimum severity required to trigger notifications using this profile

table.noProfiles: You don't have any notification profiles defined.
table.noProfilesHelp: Click the button below to add a new profile to receive notifications from Kopia.

setup.selectProviderMessage: Select where you want to store your backups
setup.checking: Checking if a Kopia destination exists at this location...
setup.repoFound: A Kopia destination was found at this location. You can connect to it with your password.
setup.noRepoFound: No Kopia destination found at this location. You can create a new destination here.

password.createSubtitle: Set a password for your new destination
password.passwordWarning: There is no way to recover your password. Store it securely! Consider using a password manager.
password.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters
password.descriptionHelper: A friendly name to help you identify this destination

providers.filesystemDesc: Store backups on a local or network-mounted drive
providers.s3Desc: AWS S3 or s3-compatible storage (minio, wasabi, etc.)
providers.rcloneDesc: Use rclone for any supported backend

filesystem.repositoryPathHelp: Local directory where destination files will be stored

s3.endpointHelp: Custom endpoint for s3-compatible storage (minio, wasabi, etc.)

azure.storageDomainHelp: Azure storage domain (leave empty for default)

gcs.credentialsFileHelp: Path to service account JSON key file

sftp.hostHelp: SFTP server hostname or ip address
sftp.keyfileHelp: Path to SSH private key file
sftp.keyPassphraseHelp: Leave empty if key is not encrypted
sftp.knownHostsFileHelp: SSH known_hosts entries for server verification (optional but recommended)

webdav.certificateFingerprintHelp: TLS certificate fingerprint for self-signed certificates (optional)

rclone.rcloneExecutableHelp: Path to rclone binary (leave empty to use system rclone)
rclone.environmentVariablesHelp: Environment variables for rclone (key=value format, one per line)

toasts.repoCreatedDesc: Your backup destination has been created successfully.
toasts.alreadyConnected: Destination is still connected. Please restart the application and try again.
toasts.invalidPassword: Invalid password. Please check your password and try again.
toasts.notInitialized: No destination found at this location. Please create a new destination instead.
toasts.serverUnavailable: Cannot connect to Kopia server. Please restart the application.
toasts.disconnectFailed: Failed to disconnect from existing destination. Please try restarting the application.
toasts.verificationFailed: Destination operation completed but connection could not be verified. Please check the destination status.

empty.title: No Repositories
empty.description: Connect to a repository to start backing up your files

removeConfirm.title: Remove Repository
removeConfirm.description: Are you sure you want to remove "{{name}}" from this app? This will not delete the repository data, only remove it from this application.

kopia.internal: An internal server error occurred. Please try again.
kopia.invalidPassword: Invalid password. Please check your password and try again.
kopia.malformedRequest: Invalid request format. Please try again.
kopia.notConnected: Not connected to destination. Please connect first.
kopia.notInitialized: Destination not initialized. Create a repository first.
kopia.storageConnection: Failed to connect to storage. Please check your configuration.
kopia.accessDenied: Access denied. Please check your permissions.
kopia.serverStartFailed: Failed to start Kopia server. Please check the logs.
kopia.serverNotRunning: Kopia server is not running. Please start the server first.
kopia.serverNotReady: Kopia server is not ready yet. Please wait a moment.
kopia.binaryNotFound: Kopia binary not found. Please ensure Kopia is properly installed.
kopia.repositoryConnectionFailed: Failed to connect to destination. Please check your configuration.
kopia.repositoryNotConnected: Not connected to destination. Please connect to a destination first.
kopia.repositoryNotInitialized: Destination storage exists but no repository was found. Create a new repository or check the path.
kopia.repositoryAlreadyConnected: Already connected to a destination. Disconnect first to connect to another.
kopia.repositoryNotFound: Destination not found at the specified location.
kopia.invalidPassword: Invalid destination password. Please check your password and try again.
kopia.storageConnectionFailed: Failed to connect to storage. Please check your storage configuration.
kopia.storageAccessDenied: Access denied to storage. Please check your credentials.
kopia.connectionRefused: Connection refused. Please check the server is running.
kopia.permissionDenied: Permission denied. Please check file permissions.
kopia.unsupportedPlatform: This feature is not supported on your platform.
